structure.unit: CHAPTER 1. - THE DEPARTMENT OF CENTRAL ENGINEERING
ARTICLE A. - DEPARTMENT OF CENTRAL ENGINEERING
Sec. 6-1002. - FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES OF THE DEPARTMENT.

law.catch_line: FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES OF THE DEPARTMENT.

text.section: Performing field surveys and engineering design services as required for the expansion and improvement of the City water and sanitary sewer systems, streets, storm sewers, parks and other facilities of the City.

section.section: Street construction (annual paving program and topics program.)
Manage the stormwater services of the City.
Review and approve construction plans for subdivisions and site plans.

Inspect construction work in all subdivisions and site plans including streets, utilities, sidewalks, driveways and storm drainage system, and the construction, reconstruction, extending and otherwise building or improving storm sewer and drainage systems.

Inspect all construction work done by City contract including streets, utilities, new sidewalks, sidewalk repairs and construction of park facilities. (10) Compute and prepare assessment rolls containing the cost to be assessed against properties benefitted by the construction of new streets, utilities, new sidewalks and sidewalk repairs.

Enforce the following: soil erosion and sedimentation control (Part 10 Chapter 5), floodprone area regulations (Part 10 Chapter 4), sidewalks, and driveways (Part 10 Chapter 7) and stormwater control and watercourse buffer regulations (Part 10 Chapter 9).
Compute and prepare monthly estimates and final estimates for paving contracts, resurfacing contracts, sidewalk contracts and water and sanitary sewer contracts.
Compute fee in lieu payments and project cost reimbursements for site plan and subdivisions.

text.section: Assisting in the review of proposed engineering surveys and engineering works used in the planning, evaluation, and design of soil erosion and sedimentation control measures. (Ord.
